clearQueue.label: Clear Queue
clearQueue.tooltip: Clears the text to speech queue in case someone spammed your queue.

modsAllowedToUse.label: Only mods allowed to use TTS
modsAllowedToUse.tooltip: Enable this Checkbox if you only want mods to be able to trigger TTS messages.

userCooldown.label: User Cooldown (seconds)
userCooldown.tooltip: How many seconds a user has to wait until he is allowed to us the TTS command again.

userMaxQueues.label: Max Queues per User
userMaxQueues.tooltip:
How many TTS queues a user is allowed to have active.
E.g. if this value is at 5, it means the user has to wait until his first TTS is played until he is allowed to queue another one.

userMaxMessageLength.label: TTS Message Length
userMaxMessageLength.tooltip:
How many characters are allowed per TTS message?
Although Twitch messages have a limit of 500 characters, it seems that text-to-speech only works on up to 270 characters.
Highest Limit: 270 characters

userPointsCost.label: Cost to trigger TTS
userPointsCost.tooltip: How many points will be subtracted when a user uses the TTS command.

enableHelpCommand.label: Enable !ttshelp
enableHelpCommand.tooltip: Enables the "!ttshelp" command for everyone. If disabled, only the broadcaster can use the command.

defaultVoice.label: Default Voice !tts
defaultVoice.tooltip:
Default voice if only command (e.g. "!tts hello") was used.
The default language was "US English Female".

randomKey.label: Unique Key
randomKey.tooltip:
This acts as a "secret key" to trigger your TTS messages.
If you notice that a TTS goes off that wasn't triggered in your channel, change your key!
It means that someone else is using this key (on purpose or accidently) to trigger messages in your stream.
So make sure your key is unique!

responseKeyMissing.value: Streamlabs TTS Queue: It looks like the $streamer hasn't set up the Unique Key value yet. TTS will not be useable.
responseKeyMissing.label: Unique Key Missing

responseNotEnoughPoints.value: @$user you don't seem to have enough points.
responseNotEnoughPoints.label: Not enough Points

responseMessageTooLong.value: @$user your message is longer than the character limit ($characterLimit).
responseMessageTooLong.label: Message Too Long

responseUserTooManyInQueue.value: @$user you have reached the limit of $maxQueue queue entries.
responseUserTooManyInQueue.label: Too many TTS in queue
